results.title: Man and his world: man changes the Nile
results.brief_description: Explains how the Nile River is controlled by dams, pumps and canals to supply water for power and irrigation and improve Egypt’s agricultural economy.

results.title: Man and his world: Japanese farmers
results.brief_description: Presents a study of the cultivation techniques and variety of machinery used by Japanese farmers in developing a rice crop from harsh and non-arable land. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Man alive
results.creator_credit: William T. Hurtz, Stephen Bosustow, American Cancer Society and United Productions of America
results.brief_description: A humorous cartoon, about the danger signs of cancer, showing that a man can be irrational about a new rattle in his car, or a warning pain in his body. Stresses the need for regular six-monthly visits to a doctor. The “hero” of the film reacts with gibes, sarcasm, clowning and devilish anger when his wife advises him to take the car to a reputable garage, and have a physical check-up himself. However, he finally seeks expert advice.

results.title: Man against a fungus
results.creator_credit: Maurice Constant, Guy Glover and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: This film dramatically portrays a struggle that is waged annually in wheat-growing areas - man against the wheat rust fungus. Views of the destruction caused during rust epidemics emphasize the urgency with which plant pathologists are endeavoring to breed resistant wheats and, eventually, to annihilate the blight. Animation, time-lapse photography and cinephotomicrography illustrate the life cycle of the fungus and the complex alternation of generations which poses one of the chief problems.

results.title: Man about Europe: Louis Armand
results.creator_credit: Georges Robin, Anthony de Lotbinière and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Pacemakers”.
Louis Armand is the most famous of all France’s civil servant/technocrats - the great moderniser with a clear and steady eye on the needs of people rather than just the capabilities of machines. During the war he organised railway resistance to the Germans, and after the war he was responsible for the electrification of the French National railway system. He persuaded the French to look for oil in the Sahara; he was the man behind Euratom; and is the leader and driving force of the French Channel Tunnel Company.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Georges Robin, Anthony de Lotbinière and BBC-TV

results.title: Mammals
results.brief_description: Presents an early art film by Roman Polanski without dialogue. Shows two men with one sled, tramping through the snow and each trying to out manoeuvre the other in order to ride on the sled. Cast features Henryka Klube and Michala Zolnierziewicza.

results.title: Mama Tina
results.creator_credit: Steve Jeffares, Stuart Menzies, December Films and Gumleaf Productions
results.brief_description: Irish mother Christina Noble has a special identity to the homeless children of Vietnam, she is known as Mama Tina. Driven by her grim childhood in Dublin, Christina moves through the streets and rubbish dumps in search of lost children. The stories related to and filmed by writer-director Steve Jeffares about Mama Tina are a testament to her love for children and her philosophy that all children are entitled to education, health care and love.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Steve Jeffares, Stuart Menzies, December Films and Gumleaf Productions

results.title: Maltese Flamingo
results.brief_description: A wonderfully wild’n’wacky ski film taking top honours at Vail’s ski film festival. Follow the adventures of 12 ski bums as they take on some of the greatest ski terrain in Europe and North America. Incredible ski action, great music gives `Maltese Flamingo’ the necessary punch to be one of the classic ski films of all time. Rated: G

results.title: Malpractice
results.brief_description: Malpractice is an emotional portrayal of a family’s efforts to come to terms with the result of medical malpractice; and a mother’s need to find out the truth. While most of the characters in this dramatic docu-drama are portrayed by actors, some hospital staff play themselves. The members of the legal profession are all practising solicitors and barristers. The findings of the tribunal are not scripted, but determined by the presentation of the case.
